intro: Cyphostemma dasypleurum, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by follicles containing seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in gardens.
